sentences.text: ITEM 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws provide for a Board of between eight and 12 directors, with the exact number fixed by a resolution of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective February 1, 2017, in conjunction with Mr. Lopez's appointment and upon the recommendation of the Governance Committee, our Board fixed the number of directors at 11.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees are standing for election at the Annual Meeting for a one-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the 11 nominees is presently serving as director on our Board and all nominees have consented to being named in this proxy statement and serving if elected by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MAJORITY VOTING STANDARD
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws provide for the approval of a majority of votes cast for the election of directors in uncontested elections like this one and require that an ncumbent director who is not re-elected tender his or her resignation from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board, excluding the tendering director, is required to determine whether to accept the resignation  taking into account the recommendation of the Governance Committee and any other factors it considers appropriate  and publicly disclose its decision regarding the tendered resignation, including its rationale for the decision, within 90 days from the date election results are certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a contested election, plurality voting is the standard for election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In voting for the election of directors, each share has one vote for each position to be filled and there is no cumulative voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR each of the director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named as proxies will vote for the election of each of the 11 nominees, unless you specify otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any director nominee were to become unavailable prior to the Annual Meeting, your proxy would be voted for a substitute nominee designated by our Board or we would decrease the size of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SELECTION OF DIRECTOR NOMINEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director nominees are generally recommended by the Governance Committee for nomination by our Board and election by our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director nominees may also be recommended by the Governance Committee for appointment to our Board, with their election by stockholders to follow at the next Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that the backgrounds and qualifications of our directors, considered as a group, provide a mix of complementary experience, knowledge and ability that allows them to effectively discharge their oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to recommend a candidate as a director nominee, the Governance Committee applies the criteria described in our Governance Guidelines, including
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the potential nominee's ability to qualify as independent, to ensure that a majority of our Board remains independent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) relevant business and leadership experience, considering factors such as size, industry, scope, complexity and global operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) experience as a board member of another public company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) experience in finance and accounting and/or executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) time commitments, including other boards on which the nominee serves;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) potential conflicts of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) ability to contribute to the oversight and governance of our company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) ability to represent the balanced interests of stockholders as a whole, rather than those of any special interest group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For incumbent directors, these criteria also include contributions to our Board and Committees, attendance record at Board and Committee meetings, compliance with our stock ownership guidelines, and mandatory retirement date to assist with Board succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee does not assign specific weights to the criteria and no particular criterion is necessarily applicable to all nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance Committee reviews the qualifications of any candidate with those of current directors to determine whether the person has experience in relevant industries and functional areas, such as finance, manufacturing, and technology, to ensure that our Board is able to fulfill its oversight responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sources for identifying potential nominees include existing Board members, our senior management, executive search firms, and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   16 | |

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be considered at the 2018 Annual Meeting, stockholder nominations must comply with the requirements referenced in the last section of this proxy statement under Submission of Stockholder Items for 2018 Annual Meeting.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR QUALIFICATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has identified the following qualifications for our directors to possess to provide oversight and stewardship of our company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: QUALIFICATION   DESCRIPTION   VALUE TO OUR BOARD AND STOCKHOLDERS   # (%) OF NOMINEES Global Exposure   Seniority in a global enterprise or significant experience in international markets   Gives us insight into the geographic markets in which we operate, helping us remain competitive in mature markets and gain share in faster-growing emerging markets   11 (100%) Senior Leadership Experience   Experience as president, chief executive officer or in similar senior executive positions   Provides us valuable perspectives from leaders with hands-on executive management experience to help us assess our operations, execute our strategies, mitigate related risks, and improve our policies and procedures   10 (91%) Board Experience   Prior or concurrent service on other SEC-reporting company boards   Helps reinforce management accountability for maximizing long-term stockholder value and promote corporate governance and executive compensation best practices   10 (91%) Industry Background   Experience in the retail, packaging or consumer goods industries   Allows us to better understand the needs of our customers in developing our business strategies, as well as evaluate acquisition opportunities   8 (73%) Financial Sophistication   Expertise in accounting, auditing, tax, banking, insurance, or investments   Provides insights on managing our capital structure, optimizing stockholder distributions, undertaking significant transactions, and ensuring proper accounting, financial reporting and internal controls   4 (36%)

sentences.text: BOARD REFRESHMENT AND DIRECTOR SUCCESSION PLANNING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Governance Guidelines reflect our Board's belief that directors should not be subject to term limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While term limits could facilitate fresh ideas and viewpoints being brought to the Board, our Board believes they are counter-balanced by the disadvantage of causing the loss of a director who over a period of time became well-versed in our strategies, operations and risks and is providing valuable contributions to Board deliberations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our decision not to establish term limits is consistent with the prevailing practice among companies in the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recognize that certain governance stakeholders have suggested that longer-serving directors may have decreased independence and objectivity; however, we believe that arbitrarily removing knowledgeable directors and the oversight consistency they bring  particularly during periods of executive management change similar to our very recent CEO transition  weighs against restricting director tenure through term limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ultimately, it is our Board's responsibility to establish board refreshment policies, using its discretion in the best interest of our company and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted the policies described below to facilitate regular refreshment of our Board and ensure that it continues to independently challenge our management with continuously refreshed points of view.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POLICIES SUPPORTING BOARD REFRESHMENT POLICY   DESCRIPTION   EVENTS OCCURRING AT OR SINCE 2016 ANNUAL MEETING Mandatory Resignation Policy   Incumbent directors who are not elected by our stockholders must tender their resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All incumbent directors were elected at the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mandatory Retirement Policy   Directors must retire on the date of the annual meeting of stockholders that follows their reaching the age of 72.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since inception, this policy has never been waived.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No directors retired as a result of this policy on the date of the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resignation Tendered Upon Change in Principal Employment  Directors who change the principal occupation, position or responsibility they held when they were elected to our Board must volunteer to resign from the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butier replaced Mr. Scarborough as our CEO, effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors on our Board determined that Mr. Scarborough should remain on the Board and elected him as Executive Chairman, effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior Notice Requirement to Prevent Over- Boarding   Directors must give prior notice before accepting another public company directorship so that the director's ability to fulfill Board responsibilities may be appropriately evaluated if he or she serves on more than four other public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, Mr. Anderson joined the board of Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. and resigned from one of the other boards on which he then served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While he does not serve on more than four other public company boards, the Governance Committee affirmatively determined that Mr. Anderson should continue to serve on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past six years, five directors retired from our Board as a result of our mandatory retirement policy and two of our directors resigned from our Board (not due to any disagreement with our company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Governance Committee, Mr. Lopez was appointed to our Board as an independent director, effective February 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our CEO transition, Mr. Butier joined our Board as a non-independent director in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this recent experience  coming after four new independent directors were appointed to our Board between 2009 and 2013  demonstrates our commitment to Board refreshment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   18 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average tenure of our director nominees is approximately nine years, which we believe is comparable to the average tenure for companies in the S&P 500 and within the six-to-ten year band in which the majority of these companies fall.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The graph below shows the tenure of our director nominees, which we believe is balanced between new directors who bring new ideas and insights and longer-serving directors with deep institutional knowledge of our Board and company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR DIVERSITY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we do not have a formal policy regarding the consideration of diversity in selecting director nominees, the Governance Committee seeks to recommend individuals with a broad diversity of experience, profession, skill, geographic representation and background, which may include consideration of personal characteristics such as race, gender and national origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While diversity is a consideration, nominees are not chosen or excluded solely or primarily on that basis; rather, the Governance Committee focuses on skills, expertise and background to complement the existing Board in light of the diverse and global nature of our businesses and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recognizes the benefits of racial, ethnic and gender diversity in the boardroom, including better reflecting our global customer base and the healthy debate that results from different viewpoints that may stem from diverse backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three independent directors most recently appointed to our Board have increased the diversity of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following pages provide information on each director nominee for election at the Annual Meeting, including his or her age, current board eadership roles, and business experience during at least the past five years.

sentences.text: We also indicate the name of any other public company board on which each nominee currently serves, or has served during the past five years; for these purposes, "public company" means one that is required to file reports with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the information presented regarding each nominee's experience and qualifications that led our Board to conclude that he or she should serve as a director  which includes senior leadership experience, global exposure, industry background, financial sophistication, and public company board experience  we believe that each of them has integrity and adheres to our high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee also has demonstrated the ability to exercise sound judgment, as well as the commitment to serving the long-term interests of our stockholders.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recommending non-employee director compensation to our Board, the Compensation Committee seeks to target the median compensation at companies similar in size, global scope and complexity with which we compete for director talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of this compensation is delivered in equity to align director interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 DIRECTOR COMPENSATION PROGRAM AND RECENT CHANGES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director compensation table provides information regarding the compensation earned by or awarded to our non-employee directors during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the changes described below, total non-employee director remuneration increased from $225,000 to $250,000 effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2015, the Compensation Committee considered the design of our non-employee director compensation program, which had not changed for three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Compensation Committee's request, Willis Towers Watson reviewed trends in board compensation and assessed the competitiveness of all components of our program, including cash compensation (Board and Committee retainers), equity grants, total direct compensation (annual cash plus equity), total remuneration, stock ownership guidelines, and the additional retainer for the Lead Independent Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using data from public filings of companies ranked in the Fortune 375-500 with median 2014 revenues of $6.0 billion, Willis Towers Watson, the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant, determined that our total annual remuneration of $225,000 was below the median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Willis Towers Watson recommended that the program be changed to maintain its market-competitiveness and continue allowing us to attract and retain qualified directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the advice of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   23 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Willis Towers Watson, the Compensation Committee recommended to our Board that the following changes be made to target total non-employee director compensation at the then-projected market median through 2017:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increase target total remuneration to $250,000, reflecting the 10%-13% growth rate in outside director compensation among large companies in recent years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increase the amount of annual equity compensation from $125,000 to $140,000, granted 100% in the form of RSUs consistent with the prior program and market practices; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: raise the annual Board retainer from $90,000 to $100,000 and the supplemental Lead Independent Director retainer from $20,000 to $25,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After consideration of the advice from the independent compensation consultant, the recommendation of the Compensation Committee and further iscussion, the Board approved the revised program, effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary components of the former and current non-employee director ompensation programs are summarized in the chart below and described thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNUAL NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THROUGH APRIL 2016 BEGINNING MAY 2016 Equity Grant of Restricted Stock Units $ 125,000 $140,000 Cash Retainer $ 90,000 $100,000 Match of Charitable/Educational Contributions $ 10,000 No change Additional Cash Retainer for Lead Independent Director $ 20,000 $25,000 Additional Cash Retainer for Audit Committee Chair $ 20,000 No change Additional Cash Retainer for Compensation Committee Chair $ 15,000 No change Additional Cash Retainer for Governance Committee Chair $ 15,000 No change TARGETED AT MEDIAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of these increases, the Compensation Committee also increased our non-employee director stock ownership guidelines to require ownership of the lesser of the dollar amount of $500,000 (up from $325,000) and 7,500 (up from 6,500) shares, effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, upon the advice of Willis Towers Watson, the Compensation Committee further revised our non-employee director stock ownership guidelines, effective as of the Annual Meeting, to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) eliminate the share guideline, maintaining only the dollar guideline, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) discontinue considering stock option gains towards measuring guideline compliance, counting only shares owned, deferred stock units and unvested RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes are consistent with the changes made to our executive stock ownership guidelines effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the advice of Willis Towers Watson, the Compensation Committee also recommended to our Board that the supplemental Lead Independent Director retainer be increased from $25,000 to $30,000 to more closely align with market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board approved the increased supplemental Lead Independent Director retainer, effective May 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EQUITY COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 equity grant to non-employee directors was made on May 1, 2016 in the form of restricted stock units (RSUs) that vest ratably over three years, except that all unvested RSUs fully vest upon a director's death, disability, retirement from our Board after reaching age 72 or termination of service within 24 months after a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested RSUs are generally cancelled in the event a director voluntarily resigns, is not re-elected by our stockholders or is otherwise asked to leave our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On May 1, 2016, each of our then-serving directors was granted 1,922 RSUs with a grant date value of approximately $140,000 based on the fair market value of our common stock on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 1, 2017, the effective date of his appointment to our Board, Mr. Lopez received a prorated equity grant for the remainder of the term expiring at the Annual Meeting, consisting of 445 RSUs with a grant date value of approximately $35,000 based on the fair market value of our common stock on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are subject to the stock ownership guidelines described above and are prohibited from hedging or pledging our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of the newest member of our Board, all of our directors are in compliance with our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our review of their written representations, none of our directors has hedged or pledged our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   24 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEFERRABLE CASH COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash retainers are paid semi-annually in arrears and prorated for any director's partial service during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are also reimbursed for travel expenses incurred to attend Board meetings and continuing education events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors may choose to receive their compensation in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) cash, either paid directly or deferred into an account under our Directors Variable Deferred Compensation Plan (DVDCP), which accrues earnings at the rate of return of certain bond and equity investment funds managed by an insurance company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) deferred stock units (DSUs) credited to an individual account pursuant to the Directors Deferred Equity Compensation Plan (DDECP); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a combination of cash and DSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our non-employee directors currently participates in the DVDCP and seven of our non- employee directors serving during 2016 participate in the DDECP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When a director participating in the DDECP retires or otherwise ceases serving as a director, the dollar value of the DSUs in his or her account is divided by the closing price of our common stock on the last date of the director's service, with the resulting number of shares of our common stock issued to the director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents, representing the value of dividends per share paid on shares of our common stock calculated with reference to the number of DSUs held as of a dividend record date, are reinvested on the applicable payable date in the form of additional DSUs credited to the accounts of directors participating in the DDECP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MATCHING GIFT PROGRAM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We match up to $10,000 per year of a non-employee director's contributions to charitable organizations or educational institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 2  ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, after considering the advisory vote on the frequency of our say-on-pay vote that took place at that year's Annual Meeting, our Board determined to hold say-on-pay votes annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, stockholders are again being asked to vote on the frequency of say-on-pay votes (see Item 3  Advisory Vote on Frequency of Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this Item 2, our stockholders are being asked to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Company's stockholders approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company's named Executive Officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Executive Compensation Tables sections of the Company's 2017 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered feedback from stockholders regarding our executive compensation program and made significant changes to our program in recent years to address this feedback and more closely align our compensation program with our financial profile and business strategies, including additional refinements during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR approval, on an advisory basis, of our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Properly dated and signed proxies will be so voted unless stockholders specify otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MEANING OF ADVISORY VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote is a vote to approve the compensation of our NEOs, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) and Executive Compensation Tables sections of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is not a vote on our general compensation policies or any specific element of these policies, the compensation of our non-employee directors, or our program features designed to prevent excessive risk-taking as described in Risks Associated with Compensation Policies and Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the advisory vote are not binding on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in accordance with SEC regulations, the Compensation Committee will disclose the extent to which it takes into account the results of the vote in the CD&A of our 2018 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We remain committed to ongoing engagement with our stockholders to solicit their viewpoints and discuss why we believe our executive compensation program properly aligns with our strategies by encouraging our leaders to deliver strong financial performance and create superior long-term, sustainable value for our customers, employees and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 3  ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act requires that we provide our stockholders with an advisory vote on the frequency with which stockholders will have an advisory vote to approve executive compensation at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on the frequency of the executive compensation vote is a non-binding vote as to whether the executive compensation vote should occur every one, two or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may also abstain from this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stockholders last voted on the frequency of the executive compensation vote at the 2011 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At a meeting held immediately before the 2011 Annual Meeting, our Board reviewed the preliminary voting results for the frequency vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on that review and upon the recommendation of the Governance Committee, our Board determined to hold the advisory stockholder vote to approve executive compensation every one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its ongoing review of corporate governance matters and market practices and upon the recommendation of the Compensation Committee, our Board has determined that advisory votes should continue to take place annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining to recommend that stockholders vote for a frequency of every one year, our Board considered how an advisory vote at this frequency closely aligns with our practice of discussing our executive compensation philosophy, policies and programs with our stockholders on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are being asked to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the Company's stockholders determine, on an advisory basis, the frequency with which the Company's stockholders shall have an advisory vote to approve the compensation of the Company's Named Executive Officers, among the following choices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 1  every one year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 2  every two years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 3  every three years; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 4  abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on the frequency of the executive compensation vote is not binding on our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Board will take into account the result of the vote when determining the frequency of future executive compensation votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will disclose the number of votes cast for each of the above choices and our frequency determination in a Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the SEC on or before May 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also state the determined frequency in our 2018 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our current practice and to continue fostering ongoing engagement with our stockholders, your Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR holding the advisory vote to approve executive compensation every ONE year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Properly dated and signed proxies will be so voted unless stockholders specify otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove our Board's recommendation, and may choose among the four choices, none of which may receive a majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The choice that receives the plurality of the votes cast will be deemed to be the non-binding choice of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS*
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) provides an overview and analysis of the principles and practices underlying our executive compensation program and the decisions made by the Compensation and Executive Personnel Committee (referred to in this CD&A as the "Committee") related to 2016 compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This CD&A contains the following sections:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BUSINESS STRATEGY OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past five years, we have successfully executed our business strategy, which is designed to create long-term, sustainable value for our customers, employees, and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From our stockholders' perspective, that value is best measured by our total stockholder return (TSR) and economic value added (EVA), both of which are performance objectives used in our executive compensation program and inform how we set goals for top- ine growth, margin improvement, asset efficiency, and capital allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, we established long-term goals to deliver by 2015 that we believed would be critical to achieving our long-term EVA goal and delivering superior long-term TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We communicated these goals externally as commitments to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve them, we undertook a number of steps to transform our company, including the divestiture of two businesses and a product line, as well as restructuring our remaining businesses to be leaner and more customer-centric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these actions, we substantially met or exceeded each of our company's 2015 goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this fundamental business transformation, we communicated a new set of long-term goals in 2014, extending our planning horizon to 2018 and raising the bar for both organic sales growth and operating margin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over halfway through this five-year period, we are on track to deliver our company's long-term targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * This CD&A contains "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These forward-looking statements are subject to certain risks and uncertainties, which could cause actual results to differ materially from the results, performance or achievements expressed or implied thereby.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a detailed discussion of these risks, see Part I, Item 1a.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Risk Factors" and Part II, Item 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" in our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K, filed on February 23, 2017 with the SEC (our "2016 Annual Report").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders should note that statements contained in this CD&A regarding our company and business group performance targets and goals should not be interpreted as management's expectations, estimates of results or other guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the fourth quarter of 2016, we changed our operating structure to align with our overall business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we reported our fiscal year 2016 results based on the following new segments: Label and Graphic Materials, Retail Branding and Information Solutions (RBIS), and Industrial and Healthcare Materials (IHM).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These segment changes resulted in the movement of our Performance Tapes business (which was previously part of our former Pressure-sensitive Materials segment) and our Fastener Solutions business (which was previously part of RBIS) into the IHM segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2017, we announced new long-term goals for 2021 for these new segments, as well as for our company as a whole, targeting continued solid organic sales growth and double-digit growth in adjusted earnings per share (EPS) annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve our targets, we have refined our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are focused on driving outsized growth in high value product categories (organically and through acquisitions) to improve our portfolio mix over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Categories are defined as high value when they serve markets that are growing faster than gross domestic product (GDP), represent large pools of potential profit with higher-than-average variable margin, and leverage our core capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Examples include specialty and durable label materials, graphic and reflective materials, industrial tapes, and radio-frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we grew these categories faster than our base business, increasing our level of investment to support a continuation of this trend going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To grow profitably in our base business, we remain highly focused on improving productivity to increase our competitiveness and expand margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restructuring continues to be an important element of this strategy, with the majority of recent and anticipated restructuring actions focused on improving the competitiveness of our RBIS business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acquisitions have become an important part of our growth strategy, targeting companies that can increase our exposure to high value product categories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made good progress on this front in 2016, completing the acquisition of two companies and an equity investment in another, as well as executing agreements to acquire two additional companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, a key pillar of our business strategy is to be a highly disciplined allocator of capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This applies to our acquisition strategy and how we deploy capital for internal growth and productivity, as well as to our strategy for stockholder distributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ON TRACK TO DELIVER 2018 FINANCIAL TARGETS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2014, we announced long-term financial targets through 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set our long-term organic sales growth target at 4% to 5%, reflecting confidence in the trajectory of our two largest businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We targeted double-digit adjusted EPS growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the first time, we communicated externally a target for return on total capital (ROTC), which has long been a key internal financial metric for our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the combination of our growth and ROTC targets effectively communicates our value creation objectives, which together are a proxy for EVA, one of the performance objectives used in our LTI program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown below, based on our results for the first three years of this five-year period, we are on track to deliver our 2018 commitments to investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Organic sales growth, adjusted EPS, ROTC  as well as free cash flow, which is described on the next page  are non-GAAP financial measures that we provide to investors to assist them in assessing our performance and operating trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These non-GAAP financial measures are not in accordance with, nor are they a substitute for or superior to, the comparable financial measures under generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of America (GAAP) and are reconciled to GAAP in Appendix A of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ON TRACK TO DELIVER 2018 FINANCIAL TARGETS (1)  Organic sales change refers to the increase or decrease in sales excluding the estimated impact of currency translation, product line exits, acquisitions and divestitures, and, where applicable, the extra week in our fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Percentages represent compound annual growth rates, with 2013 as the base period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2)   Adjusted EPS refers to reported income from continuing operations per common share, assuming dilution, tax-effected at the full year tax rate, and adjusted for tax-effected restructuring charges and other items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Percentages represent compound annual growth rates, with 2013 as the base period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3)   Return on total capital refers to income from continuing operations excluding the expense and tax benefit of debt financing, divided by the average of beginning and ending invested capital (total debt plus shareholders' equity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE()
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal year 2016 was another year of solid progress against our long-term financial targets, in which we substantially met or exceeded our financial oals for the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the past year, we accomplished the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved net sales of approximately $6.1 billion, an increase of approximately 2% over the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grew sales on an organic basis by approximately 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased reported EPS by 20% from $2.95 in 2015 to $3.54 in 2016 and adjusted EPS by approximately 17% from $3.44 to $4.02, exceeding the high end of the $3.65-$3.85 guidance range we provided to our stockholders in February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded operating margin by 90 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered net cash provided by operating activities of $585.3 million and free cash flow of $387.1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free cash flow refers to cash flow from operations, less payments for property, plant and equipment, software and other deferred charges, plus proceeds from sales of property, plant and equipment, plus (minus) net proceeds from sales (purchases) of investments, plus (minus) free cash outflow (inflow) from discontinued operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improved our return on capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding our increased pace of investment spending (including through acquisitions), on net income from continuing operations of $320.7 million and improved capital efficiency, ROTC increased to 17%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued our disciplined approach to capital allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invested $206.6 million in capital expenditures to support growth, $237.2 million in acquisitions and an equity investment, $142.5 million in dividends and $262.4 million in share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disciplined Capital Allocation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved these results while maintaining a healthy balance sheet and continuing the disciplined execution of our capital allocation strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the last five years, we have allocated approximately $2 billion to dividends and repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we allocated nearly $405 million for these purposes by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) repurchasing 3.8 million shares (2 million net of dilution from our LTI program), or approximately 4% of our outstanding shares, at an aggregate cost of approximately $262 million and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) paying an annual dividend of $1.60 per share for an aggregate amount of nearly $143 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have paid quarterly dividends for decades and more than doubled our annual dividend rate per share since 2010; most recently, we raised the quarterly dividend rate by 11% in April 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net of dilution from our LTI program, in the last five years we have reduced our outstanding share count by 13.6 million shares, or 13%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For complete information regarding our 2016 performance, see "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations"  in particular the information contained under the heading "Non-GAAP Financial Measures"  and our audited consolidated financial statements and notes thereto contained in our 2016 Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   31 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also allocated capital to investing in our businesses to support organic growth and pursuing targeted acquisitions that support our strategy of increasing our exposure to high value product categories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we increased our spending on capital expenditures by approximately 36% over the prior year to grow our business and continued to take restructuring actions to improve our profitability and expand our margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we completed the acquisition of the European business of Mactac, as well as another small acquisition and an equity investment in another company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mactac manufactures pressure-sensitive materials that primarily complement our existing graphics portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More recently, we completed our acquisition of Hanita Coatings, a pressure-sensitive manufacturer of specialty films and laminates, and announced our agreement to acquire Yongle Tape Company, Ltd., a manufacturer of specialty tapes and related products used in a variety of industrial markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THREE- AND FIVE-YEAR CUMULATIVE TSR OUTPERFORMANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As shown below, with TSR of nearly 15% in 2016, we delivered cumulative TSR for the 2014-2016 three-year period and the 2012-2016 five-year period that outperformed the S&P 500 and the median of the S&P 500 Industrials and Materials subsets (we are a member of the Materials subset, but also share many characteristics with members of the Industrials subset; investors have informed us that they look at both subsets in evaluating our relative performance, as we do internally).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR measures the return that we have provided our stockholders, including stock price appreciation and dividends paid (assuming reinvestment thereof).

sentences.text: 2016 SAY-ON-PAY VOTE AND ONGOING STOCKHOLDER ENGAGEMENT ON COMPENSATION MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued our long-standing practice of ongoing dialogue with stockholders in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We had made significant changes to our executive compensation program over the previous few years to address direct feedback from our stockholders and more closely align our LTI program with our financial profile and business strategies, demonstrating the Committee's commitment to paying for performance and being responsive to stockholder feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we were able to discuss the impact of these changes with our stockholders, who expressed support for the current structure of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Results and Analysis of 2016 Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting, approximately 96% of our stockholders approved, on an advisory basis, our executive compensation, up from 92% at the 2015 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The level of support we received remained strong after a significantly lower approval rate in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that this approval rate, along with the positive feedback we received during our engagement with stockholders, indicates strong support of the changes to our compensation program made in recent years, as well as our consistently improving CD&A disclosure over the last few years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement Program and Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value stockholder feedback on our executive compensation policies and practices, and we actively solicit input through our stockholder engagement program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our engagement program begins in the first quarter of each year, with the filing of our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   33 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued our long-standing practice of open dialogue with stockholders in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In advance of the 2016 Annual Meeting, we proactively contacted over 40 of our institutional stockholders, representing almost 70% of our then-outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors and management were available to answer questions or address concerns regarding our executive compensation and corporate governance programs and the items being brought to stockholder vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this effort, we received responses from stockholders representing nearly 30% of our then- outstanding shares, resulting in a few telephonic discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engaged with every stockholder who accepted our invitation to engage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the fall, we reached out to our 25 largest institutional stockholders, representing approximately 45% of our then outstanding shares to learn what issues are important to them without the time pressures associated with proxy season.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these off-season efforts, we received responses from stockholders representing over 20% of our then-outstanding shares, speaking with stockholders representing approximately 17% of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During our 2016 engagement, our stockholders expressed support for our executive compensation program, including our AIP and LTI programs, and the more graphical and streamlined disclosure in our 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, they commented favorably on our Board's execution of a seamless CEO transition and our investor relations efforts and stockholder engagement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also generally discussed the performance objectives and weightings established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO TRANSITION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, after having discussed CEO transition matters extensively during 2015, our Board elected Mr. Butier, who was then our President and Chief Operating Officer (COO), as President and CEO effective May 1, 2016, succeeding Mr. Scarborough as CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Butier had served as our President and COO since November 2014 and as our CFO from June 2010 to March 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors of our Board elected Mr. Scarborough as Executive Chairman of our Board also effective May 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recognition of the responsibilities of these respective roles, as well as the advice of its independent compensation consultant, Willis Towers Watson, the Committee made the following compensation decisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This equity grant provides for realizable gains that align directly with the long-term appreciation of our common stock and intentionally differed from our annual LTI awards to underscore its special purpose and one-time nature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERVIEW OF PAY PHILOSOPHY AND EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMPONENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has designed our executive compensation program to reflect its philosophy that a substantial majority of compensation should be tied to our success in meeting our performance objectives and creating stockholder value, providing higher compensation when we deliver superior, sustained performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of this strategy is to motivate our executives to achieve our annual and long-term financial goals and recognize their contributions to delivering strong corporate and/or business group performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee implements this philosophy by following three key principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Positioning target TDC and each component thereof at the market median, giving consideration to responsibilities, individual performance, tenure, retention, succession and market factors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligning our annual incentive awards with our annual operating plan and key financial and strategic goals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewarding long-term performance using absolute and relative TSR, as well as cumulative EVA, to focus our executives on consistent and sustainable stockholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive compensation for 2016 consisted of a target award opportunity under our AIP and LTI programs, with payouts determined based on our performance against goals established by the Committee in February 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee structures annual incentive compensation to reward NEOs based on corporate and/or business group performance to motivate them and align their compensation with stockholder interests, recognizing their individual contributions in achieving these results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our LTI awards provide upside opportunity for exceeding performance targets and downside risk, up to and including cancellation, for failing to achieve threshold performance, with EVA targets generally consistent with performance at the low end of our externally communicated long-term financial goals for earnings growth and ROTC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AIP targets are generally established at or above the midpoint of our annual guidance and consistent with our long-term financial goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STRONG COMPENSATION GOVERNANCE PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program incorporates the following best practices, which the Committee believes ensure that it serves the long-term nterests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: POLICY OR BEST PRACTICE   DESCRIPTION AND BENEFIT TO OUR STOCKHOLDERS PAY FOR PERFORMANCE Median Targeting   TDC (base salary + annual cash incentive opportunity + long-term equity incentive opportunity) and the components thereof are targeted at the median of companies similar in size, scope and complexity, giving consideration to responsibilities, individual performance, tenure, retention, succession and market factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority of Compensation Performance-Based   84% of the target TDC for Mr. Butier as our CEO and 71% of the average target TDC of our other NEOs (excluding Mr. Scarborough) was tied to company performance and subject to cancellation if our threshold performance is not achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capped Annual Incentive Set At or Above Midpoint of Guidance   Annual cash incentive compensation is based primarily on our achievement of performance objectives targeted at or above the midpoint of our annual guidance and consistent with our long-term financial goals, and secondarily on the Committee's assessment of our CEO's achievement of his predetermined and objectively measurable goals and our other NEOs' individual contributions, with awards capped at 200% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Long-Term Equity Incentive Compensation   Our equity-based incentive awards emphasize long-term performance, with PUs cliff-vesting at the end of three years and MSUs having an average performance period of 2.5 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation aligns NEO interests with stockholder interests by delivering compensation dependent on our long-term performance and stockholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Annual Stock Options   Given their past adverse impact on our burn rate and related stockholder feedback, we last made a regular grant of stock options in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retained the ability to grant stock options for special purposes and, in 2016, in connection with our CEO transition, the Committee made a special promotion grant of stock options to Mr. Butier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BEST PRACTICES No Employment Agreements   Our NEOs are employed at will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rigorous Stock Ownership Guidelines   Our CEO is currently required to obtain and maintain shares equal to 6x his annual salary; as of the end of 2016, Mr. Butier owned shares with a market value greater than 15 times his annual salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our other NEOs (except for Mr. Scarborough) are required to obtain and maintain shares equal to 3x their annual base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our NEOs were in compliance with our stock ownership guidelines as of the end of fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging or Pledging   Our insider trading policy prohibits our directors and officers from hedging or pledging our common stock and all our NEOs are in compliance with the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Low Burn Rate   Our three-year average burn rate at the end of fiscal year 2016 of 0.6% was between the 25th and 50th percentiles of the companies in the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy   Cash and equity incentive compensation is subject to clawback in the event of fraud or other intentional misconduct on the part of an NEO that necessitates a restatement of our financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Excise Tax Gross Ups   We do not gross-up payments received in connection with termination following a change of control for excise taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double Trigger Equity Vesting   Equity awards granted after April 2012 would not be accelerated on change of control, unless the NEO were terminated without cause or terminates employment for good reason within 24 months thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Repricing/Exchange of Underwater Stock Options   Our stock option and incentive plan prohibits the repricing/exchange of underwater options without stockholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Perquisites   Other than a capped financial planning reimbursement and our payment for an annual physical examination, our NEOs receive a flat taxable executive benefit allowance in lieu of enumerated perquisites that is not subject to any tax gross-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reasonable Severance Benefits   Severance formula requires qualifying termination (applicable to all NEOs except for Mr. Scarborough): CEO: 2x (annual salary + highest AIP award in last three years + cash value of 12 months of health insurance premiums) Others: 1x (annual salary + highest AIP award in last three years + cash value of 12 months of health insurance premiums) Reasonable Change of Control Benefits   Change of control severance formula requires qualifying termination within 24 months of a change of control (applicable to all NEOs except for Mr. Scarborough): CEO: 3x (annual salary + highest AIP award in last three years + cash value of 12 months of health insurance premiums) + prorated AIP award for year of termination Others: 2x (annual salary + highest AIP award in last three years + cash value of 12 months of health insurance premiums) + prorated AIP award for year of termination STRONG GOVERNANCE Independent Oversight   The Committee is comprised solely of independent directors and its executive compensation decisions are reviewed and ratified by our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DISCUSSION OF COMPENSATION COMPONENTS AND DECISIONS IMPACTING 2016 COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee aims to have base salaries at the market median, with the substantial majority of NEO compensation consisting of incentive compensation to advance the Committee's pay-for-performance philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This methodology drives higher realized compensation when our financial performance is stronger and lower realized compensation when our financial performance is weaker.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, it provides the Committee with the flexibility to respond to changing business conditions, manage compensation to reflect career progression, and adjust compensation to reflect differences in executive experience and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BASE SALARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increases in base salary are generally driven by the average percentage merit increase given to our U.S. employees, subject to marginal increase or decrease based on the NEO's performance and the market median for positions with similar scope and responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved base salary increases of approximately 3% for our then-serving NEOs consistent with the average increase for U.S. employees, except for Messrs. Butier and Scarborough and Ms. Bramman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our CEO transition,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Mr. Butier's base salary increased approximately 44% effective May 1, 2016, resulting in a base salary intentionally set below the market median (at the 40th percentile) to reflect his initial appointment into the role, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Mr. Scarborough's base salary decreased approximately 22% effective May 1, 2016, resulting in a base salary at the market median for an executive chairman role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bramman's base salary increased nearly 5% to make her salary more consistent with the market median.

sentences.text: In setting the targets for these objectives, the Committee's goals were to ensure consistency with our long-term financial targets and require adjusted sales growth and adjusted EPS improvement from the actual amounts achieved in the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These were the same objectives and weightings used fo purposes of the 2015 AIP to continue incenting our NEOs to increase sales on an organic basis, consistently and sustainably improve profitability and generate strong free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target adjusted sales growth was set at the low end of our long-term target, reflecting top-line challenges in the retail apparel market served by our RBIS business; however, the target required significant improvement from the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target adjusted EPS was established at the midpoint of the guidance we announced to investors in January 2016 and represented a 9% increase (a 15% increase on a constant currency basis) from our actual performance for this measure in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target free cash flow was set 5% above the $300 million included in our 2015 financial targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we did not externally communicate a free cash flow target as part of our 2018 goals, we continue to expect our businesses to generate strong free cash flow, an important metric used internally and by our investors in evaluating our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although lower than our 2015 result, our 2016 target for free cash flow reflected increased capital expenditures planned for 2016 to support the future growth of our businesses and required to achieve our long-term financial targets.

sentences.text: 2016 NEO Performance Evaluations & Individual Modifiers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are evaluated on their individual performance for the year, with the Committee approving our CEO's goals for the year and our CEO approving the goals of our other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs' performance is assessed in February of the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the NEOs other than our CEO, this assessment considers the totality of their performance rather than assigning weightings to each of the performance goals.

sentences.text: Individual modifiers are capped at 150%, subject to the total cap on AIP awards of 200%.

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed and evaluated Mr. Butier's 2016 performance as CEO, taking into account his performance against the predetermined and objectively measurable strategic objectives established in February 2016, his self-assessment of his performance, and market reference and other data provided by Willis Towers Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO is not involved in the decisions regarding his compensation, which are determined by the Committee meeting in executive session with Willis Towers Watson.

sentences.text: The Committee determined the individual modifier for our CEO based on its assessment of his performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO recommended to the Committee the individual modifiers for our other NEOs based on his assessment of their 2016 performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered our CEO's recommendations and challenged his assessments as needed, while retaining the discretion to approve individual modifiers for our other NEOs lower than what the CEO had recommended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than discussing with our CEO their performance against their individual performance plans, our other NEOs played no role in their compensation determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, our CEO recommended that his individual modifier and that of the NEOs reporting to him generally be capped at 100% based on his belief that the incentive compensation for our senior executives should be based primarily on delivering long-term company and business group performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee agreed with our CEO's recommendation to advance its pay-for-performance philosophy, and capped the modifiers of Mr. Butier and the NEOs reporting to him for 2016, retaining the right to determine individual modifiers of greater than 100% in future years if it deems necessary to reward a particular NEO for extraordinary performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined Mr. Scarborough's individual modifier at 110% to recognize his mentorship and the smooth transition of his CEO responsibilities to Mr. Butier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the individual modifiers for our other NEOs and recognizing that the cap of 100% eliminated the potential upside from the individua modifier on their AIP awards, the Committee highlighted the following regarding the 2016 performance of the NEOs reporting to Mr. Butier:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Bramman  Led our company's finance function in support of our company substantially achieving or exceeding its 2016 financial targets for organic sales growth, adjusted EPS and free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gravanis  In his second year leading the business now known as Label and Graphic Materials, Mr. Gravanis delivered organic sales growth, free cash flow and EVA that exceeded our annual targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hill  Led our human resources function in support of a seamless CEO transition and other leadership changes resulting from the realignment of our operating structure to align with our overall business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Miller  Led our legal function, in support of acquisitions, capital investments and restructuring actions across our businesses, while continuing to advance our values and ethics program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Scarborough, the Committee noted that he successfully mentored and transitioned his CEO responsibilities to Mr. Butier and continued his strong leadership of our Board as Executive Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the above assessments and after giving consideration to the recommendations of our CEO (other than with respect to himself), the Committee approved individual modifiers of 100% for all of our NEOs, except for Mr. Scarborough whose individual modifier was approved at 110%.

sentences.text: 2016 GRANTS OF LTI AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our LTI program provides variable incentive compensation to enhance alignment of executive interests with stockholder interests and drive long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual LTI awards granted in 2016 were fully performance-based and delivered in the following equity awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% in PUs that cliff-vest at the end of a three-year period subject to our achievement of the cumulative EVA and relative TSR performance objectives established for the award; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% in MSUs that vest at the end of the one-, two-, three- and four-year performance periods, with an average performance period of 2.5 years, based solely on our absolute TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual LTI awards were granted on February 25, 2016, the day our Board had its regularly-scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not offset the loss or gain of prior year grants in determining current year grants as doing so would compromise the intended risk/reward nature of these incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual amounts realized from the vesting of these awards will be based on our performance, as well as our stock price, at the time of vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we have suspended the regular grant of stock options and RSUs to our executives, special awards may be granted by the Committee for hiring, promotion or retention purposes, with the awards granted on the first day of the last month of the calendar quarter following the hiring or promotion event or decision to make a retention grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved one special NEO award in 2016, which was for Mr. Butier in connection with his promotion to CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The option to purchase 141,108 shares of our common stock was granted on June 1, 2016 with a grant date fair value of approximately $2,000,000 and will vest 50% on each of the third and fourth anniversaries of the grant date, subject to his continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target LTI Opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a percentage of base salary, the target LTI opportunities for our NEOs were 400% for Mr. Butier (increased from 300% following his promotion to CEO); 300% for Mr. Scarborough (decreased from 450% to reflect his new role as Executive Chairman); 200% for Ms. Bramman (increased from 180% because her previous LTI opportunity was lower than the market median given that she was new to the CFO role at that time); and 180% for Mr. Gravanis and Mses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hill and Miller.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These target LTI award opportunities represented approximately 64% and 52%, respectively, of our CEO's, and other NEOs' (excluding Mr. Scarborough) average, total incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Units (PUs)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awarded under our 2016-2018 Mid-Term Incentive Plan (MTIP), PUs cliff-vest in shares of our common stock after the end of a three-year period at threshold (50% payout), target (100% payout) and maximum (200% payout) levels based on our achievement of the performance objectives established for the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PUs do not accrue dividend equivalents and are not counted towards measuring compliance with our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the 2015-2017 MTIP, the Committee selected the following performance objectives for the 2016-2018 MTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that these objectives continue to appropriately align executive compensation with the long-term interests of our stockholders because delivering strong TSR relative to peer companies and cumulative EVA directly impacts stockholder value creation and the number of shares executives may receive at vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cumulative EVA, weighted 50% for our corporate NEOs (based on our total company EVA) and 75% for our business group NEO (based on the cumulative EVA for his business group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EVA is a measure of financial performance calculated by deducting the economic cost associated with the use of capital (weighted average cost of capital multiplied by average invested capital) from our after-tax operating profit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee established corporate EVA goals consistent with the long-term targets we announced in May 2014 and our key financial objective of delivering superior TSR, with the target payout at the low end of our 2018 growth targets and the maximum payout at the high end of our 2018 growth targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targets for our business groups focused on EVA change compared to the prior three-year period, with the target payout for executives linked to our Materials Group business (including Mr. Gravanis) requiring positive EVA and significant change in EVA, with the cost of capital being fixed over the performance period, but reassessed annually for new cycles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Average invested capital is targeted to increase at a rate substantially below our targeted rate of organic sales growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the AIP, cash restructuring charges, which include severance and related costs and exclude asset impairment charges and lease and other contract cancellation costs, are included in EVA calculations as it is expected that these investments will generate a return over the MTIP's longer performance periods (in contrast to the AIP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether linked to corporate or business group results, 2016-2018 targets require continued improvement in our business performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
