sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR compared to an objectively determined peer group of companies, weighted 50% for our corporate NEOs and 25% for our business group NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR measures the return that we have provided our stockholders, including stock price appreciation and dividends paid (assuming reinvestment thereof), expressed as a percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR is a common metric used by the investment community to measure return on investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with its pay-for-performance philosophy, the Committee designed the TSR objective to provide realized compensation only if our stockholder value creation compares favorably relative to the designated peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee established the threshold payout level at TSR at the 40th percentile, the target payout level at TSR at the 50th percentile and maximum payout level at TSR at the 80th percentile, which were the same levels used for the 2015-2017 MTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reflecting previously received stockholder feedback, payouts for the relative TSR component of these PUs is capped at 100% of target if our absolute TSR is negative in the 2016-2018 performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing the rigor of the TSR objectives, the Committee noted that our stock price and TSR had substantially increased in the last few years; as a result, performing at the median relative to our peers over the 2016-2018 performance period would represent strong performance, particularly in light of the significant headwinds from currency, the uncertain economic environment and the end market challenges in the apparel industry served by our RBIS business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the 2015-2017 MTIP and upon the recommendation of Willis Towers Watson, to benchmark TSR, the Committee continued utilizing a peer group(  ) comprised of U.S. companies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) in similar industries based on their being classified in one of five GICS codes (diversified chemicals (15101020), specialty chemicals (15101050), metal and glass containers (15103010), paper packaging (15103020), and paper products (15105020)) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) with revenues during the last twelve months of $1 billion to $20 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee continued using these objective criteria to benchmark TSR against companies that are in similar industries and of similar size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the formulaic application of the same objective criteria, the peer group changed from the prior year as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Innospec Inc. and Platform Specialty Products Corp. were added because they met the revenue threshold of $1 billion;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) Multi Packaging Solutions International Ltd., The Chemours Co. and WestRock Co. were added because they became public companies in 2015 and met the criteria;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) FMC Corp. was deleted because its GICS code was reclassified; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) Verso Corporation was deleted because it filed for bankruptcy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee noted that all of the U.S. companies designated by a leading proxy advisory firm in March 2016 as peers of our company were included in the TSR peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined that it was appropriate to use an equity vehicle that has one-, two-, three- and four-year performance periods because MSUs replaced stock options and RSUs, both of which vested ratably over four years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The transition from the combination of stock options and RSUs to MSUs was made to address burn rate concerns raised by our stockholders and improve the performance linkage of our LTI program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although stock options had been negatively impacting our burn rate, they were easily understandable to executives and viewed by them as performance-based given that they required stock price appreciation to deliver value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs, which were generally granted in smaller amounts than stock options as a result of their respective grant date fair value, delivered guaranteed value if executives remained employed through the applicable vesting dates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MSUs were designed to achieve the combined objectives of these previously-used equity vehicles, including retention (similar to RSUs) and the provision of meaningful upside opportunity tied to stock price appreciation (similar to stock options, but more limited due to fewer shares earned for target performance and a cap on the number of shares that can be earned above target), while making the LTI program fully performance based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee continues to believe that retention is an important objective of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MSUs vest based on our performance as shown on the graph below, with the number of shares paid out based solely on our absolute TSR and the value realized reflecting both the number of shares paid out as well as our stock price at the time of vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although dividend equivalents accrue on MSUs during the performance period, they are earned and paid only at vesting; as such, if the threshold level of performance were not achieved, any dividend equivalents accrued during the performance period would be cancelled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares paid out at vesting for the MSUs granted in 2013 and 2014 reflected the performance criteria shown on the left below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee significantly changed the MSU program beginning in 2015, making the threshold and target performance criteria more challenging to reflect stockholder feedback and our improved financial profile and business strategies, as shown on the right below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To help mitigate the effect on participants of more challenging threshold and target hurdles, the Committee also proportionally increased the number of shares paid out for achieving threshold performance from 70% to 85% and decreased the TSR required for a maximum payout from 100% to 75%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined to maintain the same MSU program for 2016 to gain more payout experience to ensure that the program's revised structure is achieving the Committee's goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for Mr. Gravanis, our NEOs are eligible to participate in our nonqualified deferred compensation plan, which allows eligible U.S. employees to defer up to 75% of their base salary and up to 90% of their AIP award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we previously allowed deferral of LTI awards, we suspended this plan feature in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan provides NEOs and other eligible employees with a long-term capital accumulation opportunity because savings accumulate on a pre-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating executives may select from among a number of investment options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our only deferred compensation plan currently open for deferrals does not offer above-market interest rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferrals are 100% vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We made an annual contribution in early 2016 to the deferred compensation accounts of our NEOs of 6% of 401(k) eligible earnings in excess of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the "Code") compensation limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefit was designed to supplement 401(k) contributions that are limited under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough previously participated in deferred compensation plans that are no longer available for new deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information regarding our deferred compensation plans and accrued NEO benefits thereunder, see 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation in Executive Compensation Tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for Ms. Bramman and Mr. Gravanis, our NEOs are eligible for retirement benefits under our U.S. pension plan and benefit restoration plan, a nonqualified excess benefit plan, in each case subject to the same terms and conditions as our other eligible U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we froze the accrual of benefits under these plans as of December 31, 2010, none of our eligible NEOs accrued additional retirement benefits during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information regarding these plans and accrued NEO benefits thereunder, see 2016 Pension Benefits in Executive Compensation Tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gravanis has legally mandated retirement benefits in his previous home country of France and in his current country of the Netherlands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Retirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a supplemental executive retirement plan that provides designated executives with supplemental benefits upon retirement to induce them to remain with our company and further our long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough is the only NEO who is a participant under the plan, and the Committee does not currently intend to designate any of our other NEOs as a participant in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we froze the accrual of benefits under this plan as of December 31, 2010, Mr. Scarborough accrued no executive retirement benefits during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information on the supplemental executive retirement plan and our Executive Chairman's accrued NEO benefits thereunder, see 2016 Pension Benefits in Executive Compensation Tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Defined Contribution Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs are eligible to participate in our employee savings plan, a qualified 401(k) plan that permits U.S. employees to defer up to 100% of their eligible earnings to the plan on a pre-tax basis and 25% of their eligible earnings on an after-tax basis, subject to the annual limit prescribed by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) for the aggregate of company contributions and employee pre- and post-tax contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee deferrals are immediately vested upon contribution and we make a contribution up to 6% of an employee's eligible compensation, 3% of which is an automatic contribution and up to 3% of which is a match of 50% of the employee's contributions up to 6%, subject to certain other Code limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants vest in company contributions to their savings plan account after two years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are immediately eligible to participate in the savings plan, and all our NEOs participated in the plan during fiscal year 2016, except for Mr. Gravanis who is not a U.S. employee and was therefore ineligible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our U.S. NEOs participate in these plans subject to the same eligibility and benefit terms and conditions as our other U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Life Insurance Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the $50,000 in life insurance benefits we provide to all U.S. employees, our U.S. NEOs are provided with supplemental life insurance benefits equal to three times the NEO's base salary less $50,000, up to a maximum insurance amount of $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough ceased being eligible for these benefits effective May 1, 2016 as a result of his new role as Executive Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide $3 million of personal excess liability insurance coverage to our U.S. NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal excess liability coverage provides an additional layer of liability coverage that supplements the coverage provided by the individual's personal liability insurance.

sentences.text: SEVERANCE BENEFITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our NEOs has an employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The absence of employment agreements reflects our pay-for-performance philosophy; if an NEO is no longer performing at the expected level, he or she can be terminated immediately without receiving a contractually-guaranteed payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee believes that providing our executives with severance benefits helps ensure that they act in the best interests of our company and stockholders, even if doing so may be contrary to their personal interests, such as where it could lead to the termination of their employment or a change of control of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes the amount of these benefits and the terms and conditions upon which they are provided are consistent with market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested equity awards outstanding on the date of termination are generally cancelled, except for employees who qualify as retirement eligible under the terms of our equity incentive plans, whose awards are accelerated upon termination of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Miller and Messrs. Scarborough and Gravanis are the only NEOs who qualified as retirement eligible as of the end of fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Equity Incentive Plans section following the Payments Upon Termination as of December 31, 2016 table for further information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rights of our NEOs in the event of termination not for cause are governed by our Executive Severance Plan (the "Severance Plan") and our Key Employee Change of Control Severance Plan (the "COC Severance Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use these plans rather than individually negotiated agreements to provide us with the flexibility to change the severance benefits for which our NEOs are eligible to reflect market practices without the need to obtain their individual consent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this plan-based approach eliminates the time and expense it would require to individually negotiate separation payments and ensures that our NEOs are eligible for benefits on the same terms and conditions as employees with similar levels of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receipt of benefits under these plans is conditioned on the executive signing a waiver and release of most claims against our company, as well as agreeing to non-competition, non- solicitation, and non-disclosure covenants in favor of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any violation of these covenants could result in our company seeking to recover some or all severance benefits previously paid or pursuing any other claims that may be appropriate under the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given his localization to the Netherlands effective July 1, 2016, Mr. Gravanis' severance benefits would also be subject to applicable Dutch labor laws and regulations in effect at the time of his separation, and he would receive the greater of the amount provided under these plans and the amount required by such laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional information regarding potential NEO benefits under these plans, including the treatment of equity awards under various termination scenarios, see Payments Upon Termination as of December 31, 2016 in Executive Compensation Tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Following Involuntary Termination Not For Cause
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs, except for Mr. Scarborough, are eligible to receive severance benefits upon involuntary termination not for "cause," in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough ceased being eligible to receive these benefits effective May 1, 2016 as a result of his new role as Executive Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a qualifying termination, our CEO would be eligible to receive two times the sum of his annual salary, his highest AIP award received in the preceding three years and the cash value of 12 months of his qualified medical and dental insurance premiums; our other participating NEOs would be eligible to receive one times his or her respective sum of these amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All participating NEOs would also be eligible to receive up to $25,000 in outplacement services for up to one year following termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any payments made under the Severance Plan would be offset by any payments received by the NEO under any statutory, legislative and regulatory requirement or, if applicable, the COC Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Following Change Of Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs, except for Mr. Scarborough, are eligible for severance payments upon termination not for "cause" or by the executive for "good reason" within 24 months of a "change of control" of our company, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the COC Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough ceased being eligible to receive these benefits effective May 1, 2016 as a result of his new role as Executive Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a qualifying termination following a change of control, our CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   54 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: would be eligible to receive three times the sum of his annual salary, highest AIP award received in the preceding three years and the cash value of 12 months of his qualified medical and dental insurance premiums; our other participating NEOs would be eligible to receive two times his or her respective sum of these amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our participating NEOs would also be eligible to receive a pro-rata AIP award for the year of termination and up to $25,000 in outplacement services for up to one year following termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any payments under the COC Severance Plan would be offset by any payments received by the participating NEO under the Severance Plan and any other statutory, legislative and regulatory requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our equity incentive plans, unvested equity awards granted to our participating NEOs after April 26, 2012 would vest only if the participating NEO is terminated without "cause" or resigns for "good reason" within 24 months after the change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our participating NEOs are not eligible to receive any excise tax gross-up on amounts payable under the COC Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if a participating NEO would otherwise incur excise taxes under Section 4999 of the Code, payments under the COC Severance Plan may be reduced at the participating NEO's election so that no excise taxes would be due.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION-SETTING TOOLS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: USE OF MARKET SURVEY DATA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually considers market survey data to target TDC, looking at a cross section of U.S. companies to reflect the broad talent market across which we seek our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Committee reviews results from surveys prepared by third parties to understand market compensation practices and assess our competitiveness, narrowing the scope of the results to account for variations caused by company size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee was presented with industry-wide data from the following published compensation surveys, with executive matches based on job and functional responsibility:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the most recent Willis Towers Watson U.S. Compensation General Industry Database, which was narrowed in scope to focus on the data of the 82 participants with $6 billion to $10 billion in annual revenues, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the most recent Hewitt Total Compensation Measurement Survey, which was narrowed in scope to focus on the data of the 59 participants with $5 billion to $10 billion in annual revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the data from each survey on an aggregated basis, with no consideration of either survey's respective component companies, which were not determined or known by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses the survey data as a reference point to target TDC and the components thereof at the market median, giving consideration to responsibilities, individual performance, tenure, retention, succession and market factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: USE OF PEER GROUPS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For determining our relative TSR for purposes of vesting PUs granted under the 2014-2016 MTIP and 2016-2018 MTIP, the Committee used a peer group comprised of U.S. companies satisfying objective criteria for industry classification and revenue size, the names of which have been disclosed in this CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not utilize a peer group for any other purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: USE OF TALLY SHEETS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews tally sheets that reflect the components of each NEO's compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tally sheets reviewed in 2016 included the following information for 2014, 2015 and 2016:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation history, including annual cash compensation (base salary and AIP awards), LTI awards, value of vested LTI awards, and annualized cost of benefits and perquisites;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the expected value of annual compensation for the year, including base salary, AIP award and the grant date fair value of LTI awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: accumulated value of compensation, including total accumulated value of LTI awards and accumulated benefit values under our retirement and deferred compensation plans;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a summary of potential payments under various termination scenarios; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the executive has achieved his or her applicable level under our stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that tally sheets are useful in determining compensation because they provide a historical perspective on NEO compensation and include information that will be contained in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   55 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INDEPENDENT OVERSIGHT AND EXPERTISE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that hiring and retaining effective executives and providing them with market-competitive compensation are essential to the success of our company and advance the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, which is comprised solely of independent directors, is responsible or overseeing our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may delegate authority to subcommittees or, in certain limited circumstances not elated to the compensation of our executive officers, to our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under its charter, the Committee has the authority, in its sole discretion and at our expense, to obtain advice and assistance from external advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee may retain and terminate any compensation consultant or other external advisor and has sole authority to approve the advisor's fees and other terms and conditions of the retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In retaining its advisors, the Committee must consider each advisor's independence from management, as required by NYSE listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Committee retained Willis Towers Watson as its independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Willis Towers Watson provided competitive market compensation data for senior executives; conducted periodic reviews of elements of our non-employee director, executive and employee compensation programs; assisted with annkp_0ual and LTI compensation design, including performance objectives and weightings thereof; and shared executive and non-employee director compensation trends, issues and regulatory developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Willis Towers Watson performed the following services for the Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WILLIS TOWERS WATSON 2016 SERVICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Willis Towers Watson received $133,834 in compensation from our company for professional services directly performed for or at the request of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also reimbursed the firm for its reasonable expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee conducted its annual assessment of Willis Towers Watson's performance in December 2016, which included a review of the services provided during the year, the fees paid therefor and the following additional evaluation criteria:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience  The firm's depth and breadth of executive compensation knowledge and experience; quality of staff, data, and other resources; and understanding of our business strategy and issues, industry, performance drivers and human capital considerations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence  The firm's objectivity in giving advice and making recommendations, and its willingness to provide candid feedback regarding management and Committee proposals, questions and concerns;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preparation  The quality and timeliness of the firm's reports and its review and feedback on management proposals, and the firm's preparation with the Committee Chair and management, as appropriate; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Relationship  The accessibility and availability of members of the engagement team; the firm's relationship with the Committee Chair and management; and the effectiveness of its communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, the Committee determined that it continued to be satisfied with the performance of Willis Towers Watson and the ndividual members of the engagement team serving the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   56 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISOR INDEPENDENCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Willis Towers Watson and the Committee have had the following protocols in place since the commencement of the engagement to ensure the firm's ndependence from management: the Committee has the sole authority to select, retain and terminate Willis Towers Watson, as well as authorize the firm's fees and determine the other terms and conditions that govern the engagement; the Committee directs Willis Towers Watson on the process for delivery and communication of its work product, including its analyses, findings, conclusions and recommendations; in the performance and evaluation of its duties, Willis Towers Watson is accountable, and reports directly, to the Committee; and the Committee may consult with Willis Towers Watson at any time, with or without members of management present, at the Committee's sole discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by SEC regulations and NYSE listing standards, the Committee considered the independence of its advisors in December 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee affirmatively determined Willis Towers Watson to be independent and both the firm and the members of the engagement team advising the Committee to be free of any conflicts of interest based on its review of information provided by Willis Towers Watson, members of the Committee and our executive officers related to the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other services provided to our company  During fiscal year 2016, Willis Towers Watson performed no services to our company other than executive compensation consulting services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These services included those performed as independent compensation consultant to the Committee, as well as assistance to management with a market review of global executive total compensation and U.S. and international LTI award practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fees paid by our company as a percentage of the firm's total revenue  Fees from our company reflected approximately 0.003% of Willis Towers Watson's revenue for its fiscal year ended December 31, 2016;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and procedures maintained to prevent or mitigate conflicts of interest  Willis Towers Watson has multiple such policies and procedures, including a comprehensive code of conduct and ethics and quality policies that mandate rigorous work reviews and periodic compliance reviews;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business or personal relationships with members of the Committee  Based on disclosures from Willis Towers Watson and members of the Committee, we are aware of no such business or personal relationships;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company stock owned by Willis Towers Watson firm representatives  No members of the Willis Towers Watson team serving the Committee own any stock in our company, other than perhaps through investments in mutual or other funds managed without the member's input; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business or personal relationships with any executive officer of our company  Based on disclosures from the firm and our executive officers, we are aware of no business or personal relationships with Willis Towers Watson or the members of the engagement team advising the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLAWBACK POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of fraud or other intentional misconduct on the part of an NEO that necessitates a restatement of our financial results, the NEO would be equired to reimburse our company for any AIP or LTI awards paid or granted in excess of the amount that would have been paid or granted based on the estated financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These remedies would be in addition to, not instead of, any other actions taken by our company (through the imposition of any iscipline up to and including termination), law enforcement agencies, regulators or other authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This clawback policy has been contractually cknowledged by our NEOs upon the execution of their LTI award agreements since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee approved our clawback policy in December 2009 to subject incentive compensation to forfeiture if our financial results are not achieved consistent with our high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy is expressly incorporated into our annual and LTI plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TAX IMPLICATIONS OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee aims to compensate our NEOs in a manner that is tax effective for our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m) of the Code ("Section 162(m)"), our federal income tax deductions for executive compensation are limited to the extent total compensation for certain executive officers exceeds $1 million in any one year, unless it qualifies as "performance-based."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To qualify as performance- based, compensation must, among other things, be based solely upon the achievement of objective performance goals and made under a plan that is administered by a compensation committee comprised solely of "outside directors."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the material terms of the plan must be disclosed to and approved by our stockholders and the Committee must certify that the performance goals were achieved before payments can be made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Senior Executive Annual Incentive Plan is designed in a manner intended to comply with the provisions of Section 162(m) and was last approved by our stockholders in 2014, which constituted approval of the performance-based criteria contained therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plan, our NEOs are eligible to receive a maximum annual cash incentive compensation award based on a specified percentage of our gross profit less marketing, general and administrative expenses, in each case as reported on our consolidated statement of operations for the applicable fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews the maximum plan awards and may exercise its discretion to decrease, but not increase, such awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The AIP awards granted to our NEOs in 2016 were substantially below the maximums calculated under the Senior Executive Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Senior Executive Annual Incentive Plan, we have designed certain of our other compensation programs in a manner intended to comply with Section 162(m) of the Code and related regulations so that total compensation paid to any employee covered by Section 162(m) generally should not, unless otherwise determined appropriate, exceed $1 million in any one year, except for compensation payments that qualify as "performance- based."
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to uncertainties in the applications of Section 162(m) and the regulations thereunder, there is no guarantee that deductions claimed under Section 162(m) will not be challenged or disallowed by the IRS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, although we believe that deductibility of executive compensation is an important consideration, we reserve the right to pay compensation and approve executive compensation arrangements that are not fully tax deductible if we believe that doing so is in the best interests of our company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 409A of the Code
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonqualified deferred compensation must be deferred and paid under plans or arrangements that satisfy the requirements of Section 409A of the Code with respect to the timing of deferral elections and payments and certain other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Failure to satisfy these requirements could expose individuals to accelerated income tax liabilities, penalty taxes and interest on their compensation deferred under these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a general matter, we design and administer our compensation and benefit plans and arrangements in a manner intended to cause such plans and arrangements to be either exempt from, or satisfy the requirements of, Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PENSION PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide qualified retirement benefits for eligible U.S. employees under the Avery Dennison Pension Plan (the "Pension Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs  except r Ms. Bramman, who joined our company after the Pension Plan was closed to new participants, and Mr. Gravanis, who is not employed in the U.S.  re eligible to receive benefits under the Pension Plan, including reduced benefits in the event of early retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accrual of additional benefits under e Pension Plan was frozen as of December 31, 2010; as a result, no additional accruals were made under the Pension Plan during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation covered by the Pension Plan includes base salary and AIP awards, up to the applicable statutory limitations each plan year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mployees vest in the Pension Plan after five years of service, or at age 55 upon termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual pension benefit payable as of ecember 31, 2016 was limited to $210,000 under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the Pension Plan are based on pensionable earnings, length of service, when benefits commence and how they are paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are calculated separately for each year of applicable service using a formula equal to 1.25% times compensation up to the breakpoint (which for each year prior to our freezing the accrual of additional benefits was the average of the Social Security wage bases for the preceding 35 years) plus 1.75% times compensation in excess of the breakpoint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the calculation for each year of service are added together to determine the annual single life annuity benefit under the Pension Plan for an employee at normal retirement (generally age 65), which is not subject to reduction for Social Security payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible participants may elect to receive their benefits in one of several payment forms that are all payable in monthly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are generally paid in annuity form over the lifetime of the participant and/or a beneficiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By default, single participants are eligible for a single life annuity, and they can choose from alternate payment forms that may include
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   66 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: benefits payable to a beneficiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By default, married participants are eligible for a joint and survivor annuity that is payable over the participant's lifetime, and, if survived by a spouse, over the spouse's lifetime.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Married participants can choose alternate payment forms, with the consent of the spouse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The monthly benefit each eligible participant may receive is adjusted based on the plan's definition of actuarial equivalence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are generally payable without reduction after participants reach age 65; however, certain participants  including our participating NEOs  may be eligible to receive an unreduced benefit at age 62.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to age 62, a participant's benefits are reduced by 15% for commencement of benefits at age 61, and an additional 5% for each additional year early the participant elects to receive benefits, provided that no benefit may commence before a participant reaches age 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BENEFIT RESTORATION PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Benefit Restoration Plan (BRP) is a nonqualified excess benefit plan that provides for the payment of supplemental retirement benefits to eligible participants in an amount equal to the amount by which their benefits otherwise payable under the Pension Plan would be reduced under the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All NEOs  except for Ms. Bramman, who joined our company after the BRP was closed to new participants, and Mr. Gravanis, who is not employed in the U.S.  are eligible to receive benefits under the BRP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accrual of additional benefits under the BRP was frozen as of December 31, 2010; as a result, no additional accruals were made under the BRP during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the BRP is designed to mirror the Pension Plan, the information concerning the compensation covered, benefit formula, early retirement provisions, and payment forms is similar to that of the Pension Plan except that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the BRP provides for payment in the form of a lump-sum distribution, unless a timely election is made for monthly payments over the lifetime of the participant and a designated beneficiary, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) BRP benefits are generally payable upon the later of separation from service and age 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUPPLEMENTAL EXECUTIVE RETIREMENT PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP) provides designated key executives with additional retirement benefits to induce them to remain with our company and further our long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP, a nonqualified plan, is an unfunded obligation of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accrual of additional benefits under the SERP was frozen as of December 31, 2010; as a result, no additional accruals were made under the SERP during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting age for a designated participant is determined based on the target retention date for the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the SERP would commence at the same time, and in the same form of payment, as the BRP, at a benefit level which  when added to the benefits to which a designated participant would be entitled from the Pension Plan and the BRP at the time of retirement, certain company contributions (plus interest) to the Employee Savings Plan, fixed amounts representative of his contributions to the deferred compensation plans and estimated Social Security benefits  would equal a specified percentage of the participant's average compensation as of December 31, 2010 (average of the highest 36 months of the last 60 months of base salary and annual bonuses earned or paid by December 31, 2010).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No benefits would be provided under the SERP to a participant who voluntarily terminates employment before reaching the specified vesting age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Survivor and disability benefits are payable under the SERP under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough is the only NEO designated as a participant under the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He vested at age 60 and the specified percentage of his average compensation is 62.5%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mr. Scarborough elects to retire and begins receiving benefits before reaching age 62, his benefit under the SERP would be reduced in the same manner as it would be under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE VARIABLE DEFERRED RETIREMENT PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Variable Deferred Retirement Plan (EVDRP) is our only active deferred compensation plan available to U.S. employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings are based on a fixed rate and/or the performance of variable bond and equity funds selected by the participant from available options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EVDRP does not offer investment options that provide above-market interest rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees are able to defer U.S. taxes until their investment is withdrawn, providing an opportunity for them to accumulate savings on a pre- tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also benefit from this arrangement because we do not have to expend cash to pay individuals who elect to defer receipt of these amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we can use this cash for other purposes until a deferred compensation account is paid to the participant after termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All deferred compensation amounts are unfunded obligations of our company and subject to the same risks as any of our general debts and obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, these accounts mitigate risk-seeking behavior by management that could be detrimental to the long-term health of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the EVDRP, eligible employees can defer up to 75% of their salary and 90% of their AIP award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of our NEOs, Ms. Bramman elected to defer 10% of her 2016 salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Contributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2016, we made a contribution to the deferred compensation accounts of eligible employees of 6% of an eligible employee's annual 401(k) eligible earnings in excess of the Code compensation limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our contribution was added to the deferred compensation accounts of eligible employees who were employed at year-end 2015, which included all our participating NEOs, except for Ms. Bramman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Withdrawals/Distributions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions to deferred compensation accounts are required to be distributed following an eligible employee's separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to Section 409A of the Code, eligible employees may elect to receive separation from service withdrawals in the form of a lump-sum payment or monthly installments over two to 20 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees may change the method in which payments are distributed provided that they do so at least 12 months before the date of distribution; however, any such change would result in the distribution occurring or beginning five years later than it otherwise would have.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our NEOS are "key employees" under Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions to key employees cannot be made until at least the seventh month after separation from service, except in the event of death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CAPITAL ACCUMULATION PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Capital Accumulation Plan (CAP) is a legacy deferred compensation plan that last received deferrals in 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of our NEOs, only Mr. Scarborough is a participant in the CAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CAP has a fixed rate of return designated by Pacific Life Insurance Company (4.00% for 2016), subject to enhancement by our company in accordance with the terms of the CAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CAP's enhanced annual rate of return for 2016 was 4.41%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE DEFERRED RETIREMENT PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Deferred Retirement Plan (EDRP) is a legacy deferred compensation plan that last received deferrals in 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of our NEOs, only Mr. Scarborough is a participant in the EDRP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EDRP has a fixed rate of return determined by multiplying the rolling 10-year average of the September 10-year Treasury note rate by 1.25.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EDRP's annual rate of return was 3.93% from January 3, 2016 to November 30, 2016 and 3.57% from December 1, 2016 to December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE SEVERANCE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our NEOs, except for Mr. Scarborough, is a participant in the Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon involuntary termination not for cause, they would be entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Not Subject to Gross up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are subject to withholding for all applicable taxes and not grossed-up for taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Trigger for Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary termination, which excludes termination for cause; due to disability; due to death; due to voluntary resignation; or due to an executive declining simultaneous or continuing employment in a comparable position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Definition of Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause is defined as commission of a crime or other act that could materially damage our reputation; theft, misappropriation, or embezzlement of company property; falsification of company records; substantial failure to comply with written policies and procedures; misconduct; or substantial failure to perform material job duties not cured within 30 days after written notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Scarborough ceased being eligible to participate in the Severance Plan effective May 1, 2016 as a result of his new role as Executive Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given his localization to the Netherlands effective July 1, 2016, Mr. Gravanis' severance benefits would be subject to applicable Dutch labor laws and regulations in effect at the time of his separation, and he would receive the greater of the amount provided under the Severance Plan and the amount required by such laws and regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEY EXECUTIVE CHANGE OF CONTROL SEVERANCE PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our NEOs, except for Mr. Scarborough, is also a participant in the COC Severance Plan, which is designed to retain certain key executives during a period in which a change of control transaction is being negotiated or a hostile takeover is being attempted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are only entitled to benefits if they are terminated not for "cause" or terminate employment for "good reason" within 24 months of the change of control (a "double trigger").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such circumstances, our NEOs would be entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits Not Subject to Gross-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are subject to withholding for all applicable taxes and not grossed-up for excise or other taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, f the payment would trigger an excise tax for a particular NEO, the NEO can elect to receive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) his or her full benefits, with him or her responsible for paying any applicable excise taxes or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reduced benefits to an amount sufficient to eliminate any excise tax liability.

sentences.text: Definition of Change of Control.

sentences.text: Change of control is defined as
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Compensation Committee approved, and our Board ratified, the Avery Dennison Corporation 2017 Incentive Award Plan in the form attached to this proxy statement as Appendix B (the "Equity Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Equity Plan will be effective as of the date it was ratified by our Board, subject to the approval of our stockholders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE SUMMARY OF THE EQUITY PLAN CONTAINED IN THIS ITEM 4 IS QUALIFIED IN ITS ENTIRETY BY REFERENCE TO THE ACTUAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE EQUITY PLAN, WHICH IS ATTACHED AS APPENDIX B OF THIS PROXY STATEMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RECOMMENDATION OF BOARD OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR approval of the Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Properly dated and signed proxies will be so voted unless stockholders specify otherwise.

sentences.text: OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PURPOSE OF EQUITY PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The principal purpose of the Equity Plan is to provide incentives to our employees, including the employees of our subsidiaries, and non-employee directors in the form of equity and other incentive awards to motivate them to generate superior returns for our stockholders and induce them to remain in our service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The material terms of the Equity Plan are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INCREASE IN AUTHORIZED SHARES AND EFFECTS ON EXISTING PLAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only plan under which we currently grant equity awards is the Amended and Restated Avery Dennison Corporation Stock Option and Incentive Plan (the "Existing Plan").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Existing Plan, as of February 27, 2017, the record date for the Annual Meeting, there were
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 111,202 shares subject to outstanding time-vesting restricted stock units (RSUs);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 945,348 shares subject to outstanding performance-vesting performance units (PUs) and market-leveraged stock units (MSUs) assuming target payouts for their respective performance objectives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) 705,056 shares subject to outstanding stock options (with a weighted-average exercise price of $42.70 and a weighted-average remaining contractual life of approximately five years); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) 8,521,132 shares available for future awards, of which 1,089,490 may be granted in time- or performance-vesting awards and the remaining 7,431,642 of which are reserved under the terms and conditions of the Existing Plan for grant as stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our stockholders approve this Item 4, no new awards will be granted under the Existing Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, however, our stockholders do not approve this Item 4, the Equity Plan will not become effective and the Existing Plan will remain in effect and awards may be granted under that plan in accordance with its current terms and conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Replacing the Existing Plan with the Equity Plan on a go-forward basis was ratified by our Board to enable us to continue offering incentives to our employees and non-employee directors to ensure their interests remain aligned with the interests of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of the Equity Plan will result in 5,400,000 shares being the aggregate number of shares available for issuance under our only active equity plan given that the 8,521,132 shares remaining available for issuance under the Exiting Plan will not be used.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Equity Plan, each share subject to future awards other than
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) stock options,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) stock appreciation rights (SARs), and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any other awards for which the awardee pays the intrinsic value existing as of the grant date (awards other than those described in subsections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) through
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii), are referred to as "Full Value Awards") will be counted as 1.5 shares for purposes of the number of shares authorized for issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full Value Awards include RSUs, PUs and MSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In approving and ratifying the Equity Plan, the Compensation Committee and our Board, respectively, reviewed and relied upon information provided by Willis Towers Watson, the Compensation Committee's independent compensation consultant, which included certain burn rate, dilution and overhang metrics and the costs of the Equity Plan, including the estimated stockholder value transfer cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the Compensation Committee and our Board considered the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 2015 and 2014, we granted equity awards representing a total of 621,462, 622,230 and 570,565 shares, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our three-year average burn rate, calculated by dividing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the total granted stock option and RSUs and total vested PUs and MSUs in 2014, 2015, and 2016 by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the weighted average of the number of our shares outstanding during each of those years was 0.6% of fully-diluted common shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the information provided by Willis Towers Watson, our three-year average burn rate was between the 25th and 50th percentiles of the companies in the S&P 500 based on the most recent data available (which was for 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avery Dennison Corporation   2017 Proxy Statement   74 | |
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we do not replace our Existing Plan, based on our historical usage rates of shares, we expect that we would exhaust the shares authorized under the Existing Plan by 2019 because we no longer regularly grant stock options and are limited by the number of full-value awards available for issuance under the Existing Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this were to occur, we would lose an important compensation tool to attract, motivate and retain highly qualified talent using awards aligned with stockholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our current award granting practices, we estimate that the shares authorized for issuance under the Equity Plan would be sufficient to grant awards for approximately three to five years, assuming we continue to grant awards consistent with our historical rates using our current award vehicles, as reflected in our three-year average burn rate; however, our equity grant practices could change in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total aggregate equity value of the additional shares authorized under the Equity Plan (above the shares remaining available for issuance under the Existing Plan), based on the closing price for shares of our common stock on February 27, 2017, and taking into account our fungible share pool, is $290,520,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our stockholder value transfer cost, taking into account our fungible share pool, as a percentage of our market capitalization will be approximately 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, 2015 and 2014, our year-end overhang rate, calculated by dividing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the number of shares subject to equity awards outstanding at the end of each fiscal year plus the number of shares remaining available for issuance under our Existing Plan by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the weighted average of the number of our shares outstanding during each of those years was 12.45%, 14.20%, and 17.05%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Equity Plan is approved, we expect our overhang rate at the end of 2017 to be approximately 8% (reflecting the shares authorized for issuance under the Equity Plan and excluding the shares previously authorized for issuance under the Existing Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the information provided by Willis Towers Watson, this expected overhang rate would be between the 25th and 50th percentiles of the companies in the S&P 500 for 2016 based on the most recent data available (which was for 2015).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the factors described above, and the fact that continuing to grant equity compensation is vital to our ability to continue to attract and retain employees in the competitive talent markets in which we compete, our Board has determined that the size of the share reserve under the Equity Plan is reasonable and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CONTINUING IMPLEMENTATION OF GOVERNANCE BEST PRACTICES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following terms and conditions were included in the Equity Plan based on the Compensation Committee's ongoing commitment to incorporating best practices into our executive compensation program, as well as the recommendations of management, Willis Towers Watson and our other advisors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conservative share counting, consistent with the Existing Plan and our current practice;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: "Double trigger" requirement for the accelerated vesting of equity awards in the event of a change in control, consistent with the Existing Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum vesting period of at least one year (subject to certain limited exceptions);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provision that all awards are subject to our clawback policy, consistent with the Existing Plan and the award agreements signed by awardees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on dividends and dividend equivalents being paid on unvested awards, consistent with our current practice; an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on repricing options or SARs without stockholder approval, consistent with the Existing Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that an award under the Equity Plan is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the following items will not be counted against the shares available for issuance under the Equity Plan: (A) the payment of dividend equivalents in cash in conjunction with any outstanding awards and (B) to the extent permitted by applicable law or any exchange rule, shares issued in assumption of, or in substitution for, outstanding awards of any entity acquired in any form of combination by our company or any of our subsidiaries, except as may be required by reason of Section 422 of the Code.

sentences.text: PLAN ADMINISTRATION AND GRANT MAKING PROCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee (or, with respect to awards granted to non-employee directors, our Board) is responsible for the general administration of the Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Equity Plan provides that, subject to certain limitations, our Board and the Compensation Committee may from time to time delegate authority to grant awards to a committee consisting of one or more members of our Board or the Compensation Committee or one or more of our officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms and conditions of the Equity Plan, the applicable administrator has the authority to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) select the individuals to whom awards will be made;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) determine the type of awards to be granted, the number of shares to be subject to awards and the terms and conditions of awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) determine when awards can be settled in cash, shares, other awards or whether to cancel, forfeit or surrender awards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) prescribe the form award agreements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) accelerate vesting or lapse restrictions; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) make any other determinations and to take any other actions necessary or advisable for the administration of the Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The administrator is also be authorized to adopt, amend or rescind rules relating to the administration of the Equity Plan, excluding certain matters described below that will require the approval of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to certain limitations, awards (other than awards granted to non-employee directors) under the Equity Plan are currently expected to be made in accordance with the following procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will review and approve the total annual pool of RSUs, PUs and MSUs and approve the annual equity awards to our executive officers, including the size of the awards and related terms and conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intends to delegate authority to the CEO to grant annual and special equity awards to employees other than executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following approval by the Compensation Committee or the CEO, as appropriate, special equity awards are granted on the first business day of March, June, September and December.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special equity awards, which may be granted in connection with initial hire or promotion or for retention or special recognition purposes, may have different terms than our annual equity grants depending on the purpose of the grant but will comply with the terms and conditions of the Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The practices are subject to change at any time in the administrator's discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The administrator determines which officers, employees and non-employee directors will be granted awards and no person is entitled to participate in the Equity Plan as a matter of right.

sentences.text: Currently, we have approximately 38 officers, 29,661 non-officer employees and nine non-employee directors.

sentences.text: STOCK OPTIONS AND STOCK APPRECIATION RIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options are rights to purchase shares at a specified exercise price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options will be either nonqualified stock options ("NQSOs") or ISOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs are awards entitling the awardee to exercise all or a specified portion thereof (to the extent then exercisable pursuant to its terms) and to receive an amount determined by multiplying the difference obtained by subtracting the exercise price per share of the award from the fair market value on the date of exercise of the award by the number of shares with respect to which the award shall have been exercised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SARs may be settled in cash or shares, or a combination thereof, at the election of the administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price per share subject to each stock option and SAR may not be less than fair market value on the date of grant (other than certain substitute options and SARs granted in connection with a corporate transaction) or, in the case of ISOs granted to an individual who owns (or is deemed to own) at least 10% of the total combined voting power of all classes of our capital stock, 110% of the fair market value of a share on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options and SARs may become exercisable (at the discretion of the administrator) in one or more installments after the grant date, subject to the awardee's continued employment or service and/or subject to the satisfaction of corporate performance targets and individual performance targets established by the administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Equity Plan provides that options and SARs may be granted for any term specified by the administrator that does not exceed ten years, or five years in the case of an ISO granted to an individual who owns (or is deemed to own) at least 10% of the total combined voting power of all classes of our capital stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Options generally must be exercised within six months following termination of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the period of exercisability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) following a qualifying retirement will be (A) the full term of the option for our CEO; (B) the lesser of 60 months or the full term of the option for options granted to any other officer or non-employee director; and (C) the lesser of 36 months or the full term of the option for all other optionees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) following termination of service due to death is the lesser of 12 months or the full term of the option; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) following termination of service due to disability is the lesser of 36 months or the full term of the option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, unless otherwise specified by the administrator or as otherwise directed by an awardee in writing to our company, vested options and SARs with an exercise price per share that is at least $1.00 less than the fair market value of the underlying share will be automatically exercised on the last day of their respective term.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock will generally be forfeited for no consideration or repurchased by our company at the original purchase price or such other amount as may be specified in the award agreement if the conditions or restrictions on vesting are not met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Equity Plan provides that restricted stock generally may not be sold or otherwise transferred until restrictions are removed or expire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awardees of restricted stock, unlike awardees of options, have voting rights and the right to receive dividends, if any, prior to the time when the restrictions apse; however, in the sole discretion of the administrator, any dividends will not be released until the restricted stock vests and the restrictions are removed or expire.

sentences.text: Except in connection with a spin-off or other similar event or as otherwise permitted by the Equity Plan, dividends that are paid prior to vesting of restricted stock are only paid to the holders of such restricted stock if the vesting conditions are satisfied and the restricted stock vests.

sentences.text: RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs represent the right to receive, at a specified time or times, a number of shares of our common stock or a cash payment equal to the fair market value of a specified number of shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs (including PUs and MSUs) may be awarded to any eligible individual selected by the administrator, typically without payment of consideration, but subject to vesting conditions based on continued employment or service or on performance criteria established by the administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The administrator may impose restrictions on an awardee's ability to sell, assign, transfer or pledge the shares underlying RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of grant, the administrator will specify the maturity date for each grant of RSUs, which will be no earlier than the vesting date of the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the maturity date, the shares underlying the RSUs or, in the sole discretion of the administrator, an equivalent amount of cash or a combination of cash and shares, will be transferred to the awardee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike restricted stock, awardees of RSUs generally have no voting or dividend rights prior to the maturity date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIVIDEND EQUIVALENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents may be granted by the administrator, either alone or with another award, based on dividends declared on the shares, to be credited as of dividend payment dates during the period between the date the dividend equivalents are granted to an awardee and the date such dividend equivalents terminate or expire, as determined by the administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Equity Plan provides that dividend equivalents may be settled in cash or shares and at such times as determined by the administrator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents with respect to any award will only be paid to the awardee to the extent that the vesting conditions are satisfied and the award vests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No dividend equivalents will be payable with respect to options or SARs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OTHER STOCK OR CASH AWARDS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The administrator may also grant other stock or cash awards, including awards entitling an awardee to receive shares or cash to be delivered immediately or in the future, to any eligible individual, including, without limitation, cash payments, cash bonus awards, stock payments, stock bonus awards, performance awards, incentive awards, deferred stock, deferred stock units, board and committee retainers and meeting-based fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the terms of the Equity Plan, the administrator may determine the terms and conditions of each such award, including the term of the award, any exercise or purchase price, performance goals, transfer restrictions, vesting conditions and other terms and conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other cash or stock awards may be paid in cash, shares, or a combination of cash and shares, as determined by the administrator, and may be available to settle other awards granted under the Equity Plan, as stand-alone payments, as part of a bonus, deferred bonus, deferred compensation or other arrangement and/or as payment in lieu of compensation to which an eligible individual is otherwise entitled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except in connection with a spin-off or other similar event or as otherwise permitted by the Equity Plan, dividends that are paid prior to vesting of any other stock award will only be paid to the holders of the other stock award to the extent that the vesting conditions are satisfied and the other stock award vests.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards under the Equity Plan are subject to the following annual limits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum aggregate amount that may be paid in cash to any one person in any calendar year with respect to one or more awards payable in cash is $10,000,000; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sum of the grant date fair value of equity-based awards and the amount of any cash compensation granted to any non-employee director during any calendar year may not exceed $600,000.

sentences.text: However, awards granted under the Equity Plan may vest no earlier than one year from the date on which the award is granted and no award agreement can reduce or eliminate this requirement (provided that, awards that result in the issuance of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) if the continued, assumed or substituted award is an option or SAR, then the continued, assumed or substituted option or SAR shall remain exercisable until its respective expiration date.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, except in connection with a corporate transaction involving our company, the terms of outstanding awards may not be amended without the approval of our stockholders to reduce the exercise price per share of outstanding options or SARs or cancel outstanding options or SARs in exchange for cash, other awards or options or SARs with an exercise price per share that is less than the exercise price per share of the original options or SARs.

sentences.text: AWARDS SUBJECT TO CLAWBACK
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Equity Plan, in the case of fraud or other intentional misconduct on the part of an awardee (or any other event or circumstance set forth in any clawback policy we adopt, including, without limitation, any clawback policy we adopt to comply with applicable law, including the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and any related SEC rules or regulations (including without limitation, any NYSE listing rules or standards)) that necessitates a restatement of our company's or any subsidiary's financial results (including, without limitation, any accounting restatement due to the material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement), the awardee will be required to reimburse us for any incentive compensation issued to the awardee under the Equity Plan in excess of the amount that would have been issued based on the restated financial results, as we determine pursuant to any applicable clawback policy or otherwise.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
